rationale: No matching field for 'version' in the target schema.
Both fields have identical names and descriptions, representing the unique identifier for the sample.
No matching field for 'type' in the target schema.
Both fields describe the time duration for how long the source material was stored before sample processing.
Both fields refer to the time unit of storage duration, with identical purposes.
Both fields describe the medium used during the sample preparation.
Both fields refer to the condition during the preparation, with matching names and descriptions.
Both fields refer to the time taken for processing before preservation.
Both fields describe the time unit of processing, with matching names and descriptions.
Both fields refer to the medium used to store the sample.
Both fields describe the storage method used after sample preparation.
Both fields represent the same quality criteria for the sample, with matching descriptions.
Both fields describe the type of single cell entity derived from the isolation protocol, with matching descriptions.
Both fields refer to the total number of cells or nuclei yielded, with identical descriptions.
Both fields describe whether the cell/nuclei population was enriched, with matching names and descriptions.
Both fields refer to the target of the enrichment process, with identical descriptions.
Both fields are used for general notes, with matching names and descriptions.
